RobotSoccer Python Client¶

Installing¶

python setup.py install

Using¶

from robotsoccer import SoccerClient
sc = SoccerClient()
sc.connect(host, port)
while True:
    force_left_motor = 1
    force_right_motor = 1
    sc.act(force_left_motor, force_right_motor)

TLFN Client¶

from robotsoccer import TLFNClient
sc = TLFNClient('weightfile.wts')
sc.connect(host, port)
sc.run()

API¶

class robotsoccer.client.Robot[source]¶

Robot description.

class robotsoccer.client.SoccerClient[source]¶

Client interface for a robot soccer match simulator.

All methods of this class are relative to own robot, i.e, the robot_id robot.

Notice that world_height, world_width, goal_length actually are the half of real size. This values come directly from robot soccer match.

act(force_left, force_right)[source]¶

Does action for the robot. Receives the forces of left and right motor.

connect(host='localhost', port=1024)[source]¶

Connects to robot soccer match simulator.

disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnects from robot soccer match simulator.

get_ball_angle()[source]¶

Calculates angle difference between robot and ball, in radians.

get_ball_distance()[source]¶

Calculates distance in milimeters between robot and ball.

get_obstacle_angle()[source]¶

Calculates angle difference in radians between robot and the nearest obstacle.

get_obstacle_distance()[source]¶

Calculates distance in milimeters between robot and the nearest obstacle.

get_own_goal()[source]¶

Gets own attacking goal’s center. Notice the goal of robots[1] (right) is goal[0] (left) and vice versa.

get_own_robot()[source]¶

Gets the own robot description

get_own_score()[source]¶

Gets scores of the own robot.

get_rival_goal()[source]¶

Gets attacking goal’s center of the rival. Notice the goal of robots[1] (right) is goal[0] (left) and vice versa.

get_rival_robot()[source]¶

Gets the rival robot description.

get_rival_score()[source]¶

Gets scores of the rival’s robot.

get_spin()[source]¶

Calculates the angle momentum in radians.

get_target_angle()[source]¶

Calculates angle difference in radians between robot and correspondent goal.

get_target_distance()[source]¶

Calculates distance in milimeters between robot and goal.

class robotsoccer.tlfn.TLFNClient(weight_file=None)[source]¶

Robot SoccerClient using TLFN network.

load_weights(weight_file)[source]¶

Load a weight file.

File format:

<size of input layer> <size of hidden layer> <size of output layer>
<ball dist> <ball ang> <target ang> <obst dist> <obst ang> <spin> <last leftmotor> <last rightmotor> <actual leftmotor> <actual rightmotor>
... next train set ...
run()[source]¶

Run the TLFN client.

step()[source]¶

Calculate the next motor forces and apply the act
